TopicTitle: If you were the first person on mars, what would you say?

Articles.Content:
I would continue to say

"That's one small step for a man, one giant leap for man-kind."

And try and keep it a tradition until we've been on every planet in the system.

How about you?
"Yo Dawg I heard you like mars so we put mars in mars so you can crash while you crash"

I would say (because going to Mars is my career goal)

"...And that's another great advancement in mankind history."

Edited October 17, 2012 by Bioman222
I have several 2001/10 quotes in my mind right now...
I'd rather a lady be the first on Mars than myself.
I would say:for the glory of humanity,i stay on mars!
I'd just stay dead silent, knock over a rock, write NOVA WAZ HERE in the sand, and climb back into the spacecraft.

"Wh-, Where am I-- Can't brea- "

Well, I'd try to say that, anyway. I would probably fail.

"goood mooooorning maaars!"

(Try to imagine that in capitals. It won't post it with them.)
"See? They told me it was impossible. I SHOWED THEM!"

"See? They told me it was impossible. I SHOWED THEM!"

That reminded me of something from Mock The Week.

"And now we go live to Base 3 on Mount Everest to speak with this man, who recently climbed the world's five highest peaks."

"Now do you love me daddy!? Now do you love me!?"
I would say "GET ME OFF THIS RED ROCK!!!" I think cabin(or capsule) fever would have broken me by then.
I claim this planet for Humanity! the best damn species in the known universe!

OH MY GOD WHAT IS THAT

And then I cut off my communications.
Hmm Dusty.... AND RED!!!!!! *Dramatic DUN-DUN-DUUUUUUUUUUUNNNNNNN*
"Can you send me some bacon?" That'd be what I say.

"I'm Commander Shepard, and this is my favorite planet in the Solar system."

Seriously, though, "one small step for a man" should be a tradition.

That's one small step for man, and zero steps for woman. HAR HAR WE'RE WINNING.

also

That's one small step for man, and one giant leap for Eukaryota

Edited October 9, 2012 by nhnifong
Warshawski: You're right. I'm thinking "That's another small step for [a] man, another giant leap for mankind."
"Hey, why are there footprints all over the place?"
"Well, here we are."
Wow this place is pretty RED

"A Mars a day helps you work, rest, and play".

Well, I know... But somebody had to pay for the mission.
Life finds a way
As people say change Neil's phrase to "Another small step for a man Another giant leap for Mankind" thing is I would be crying because it would be highly emotional.
